XII.ii.3.C.7.f
.
Process if Certification Is Not Received
The table below describes the process that occurs when a beneficiary fails to timely certify school attendance.
Stage
Description
1
At the EOM in May, all beneficiaries that have not timely certified school attendance receive a system-generated
due process letter, and
another
VA Form 21P-8938-1, Student Beneficiary Report – REPS (Restored Entitlement Program for Survivors)
.
Note
:  The letter advises the beneficiary of the proposed date of discontinuation, which is the first of the month after the month school attendance commenced.
2
During the EOM in July, a system-generated list of beneficiaries that have not certified school attendance is mailed to the St. Louis RO.
3
The St. Louis REPS Unit stops the award of each beneficiary that failed to certify school attendance effective the first of the month after the month school attendance commenced.
Note
:  If it becomes necessary to stop an award from an earlier effective date, the REPS Unit must send the beneficiary another notice of proposed adverse action.
Reference
:  For more information on notices of proposed adverse action, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.A
.
